content: quote: Who are these clowns in Georgia, who demand a new election because the poor babies don't like their President? Probably the ones who are sick and tired of being thrown in prison because they peacefully protest along with the ones who suffered because their insane president decided to take on an opponent who he should have known would quickly crush him. The folks suffering through homelessness and lack of basic necessities in Georgia shouldn't blame Russia but the madman Saakashvili. Had he not foolishly decided to take on the bear with the illusion that the USA would come to his aid and defend him then the Georgian people wouldn't still be suffering the aftereffects of his failed war. S. Ossetia and Abkhazia never at any time belonged to the new Georgian state when the USSR was dissolved. These provinvces fought and beat the Georgian army and won their defacto independence. Not that it is right, but demonstrations and protests are a way of life and very common in Europe. look at France, Greece, Moldova and Ukraine. All have had demonstrations against ruthless or incompetent leaders. Another thing, Georgian president serves a term of 10 years and just maybe these people who now suffer because of Saakashvili's heavy handed and almost dicator like rule dont want to suffer another 4+ years of tyranny and madness.
quote: Who are these clowns in Georgia, who demand a new election because the poor babies don't like their President?
reply: Probably the ones who are sick and tired of being thrown in prison because they peacefully protest along with the ones who suffered because their insane president decided to take on an opponent who he should have known would quickly crush him. The folks suffering through homelessness and lack of basic necessities in Georgia shouldn't blame Russia but the madman Saakashvili. Had he not foolishly decided to take on the bear with the illusion that the USA would come to his aid and defend him then the Georgian people wouldn't still be suffering the aftereffects of his failed war. S. Ossetia and Abkhazia never at any time belonged to the new Georgian state when the USSR was dissolved. These provinvces fought and beat the Georgian army and won their defacto independence. Not that it is right, but demonstrations and protests are a way of life and very common in Europe. look at France, Greece, Moldova and Ukraine. All have had demonstrations against ruthless or incompetent leaders. Another thing, Georgian president serves a term of 10 years and just maybe these people who now suffer because of Saakashvili's heavy handed and almost dicator like rule dont want to suffer another 4+ years of tyranny and madness.

content: quote: Who are these clowns in Georgia, who demand a new election because the poor babies don't like their President? Probably the ones who are sick and tired of being thrown in prison because they peacefully protest along with the ones who suffered because their insane president decided to take on an opponent who he should have known would quickly crush him. The folks suffering through homelessness and lack of basic necessities in Georgia shouldn't blame Russia but the madman Saakashvili. Had he not foolishly decided to take on the bear with the illusion that the USA would come to his aid and defend him then the Georgian people wouldn't still be suffering the aftereffects of his failed war. S. Ossetia and Abkhazia never at any time belonged to the new Georgian state when the USSR was dissolved. These provinvces fought and beat the Georgian army and won their defacto independence. Not that it is right, but demonstrations and protests are a way of life and very common in Europe. look at France, Greece, Moldova and Ukraine. All have had demonstrations against ruthless or incompetent leaders. Another thing, Georgian president serves a term of 10 years and just maybe these people who now suffer because of Saakashvili's heavy handed and almost dicator like rule dont want to suffer another 4+ years of tyranny and madness.
